column4: Hi. Has anyone here been able to get alltray working for Lucid lynx?
I click on a window and nothing happens. Using Gnome.
what version is it? still 0.69? then try the much improved 0.7.4 from launchpad.net, also check what output it gives in a terminal
then add the repo from launchpad, install that one (mind that apt thinks 0.69 is higher than 0.7.4 so be careful with updates)
It says 0.71a is the latest stable release.
try that if you don't fancy the dev version then; whatever works is ok
you know how adding ppa etc works?
nvm, you can click 'Read about installing' there, very instructive
I read that, ran the command, sorted.
reinstall windows, you will loose grub, so reinstall grub and done
can't windows do that? for ntfs better use windows; or use an ubuntu live cd and use gparted from there
You can use Gparted from the Ubuntu cd??
I thought so, at least parted; you may need to 'install' gparted, you can install stuff with a livecd session as long as it doesn't require a reboot (like video drivers)
I have gparted installed but it only shows a 320gb partition, despite ubuntu being installed alongside windows.
I'm not the man for this to debug; you don't overlook some 'scan' button?
That's ok. No there is no scan button, just one partition in /dev/sda/  298.09gb.
